trait.Name: A Sure Thing
trait.Benefit: If the creature is not evil-aligned, this ability is wasted with no benefit

trait.Name: Accelerated Drinker
trait.Benefit: You may drink a potion as a move action instead of a standard as long as you start your turn with the potion in your hand.
trait.Description: You know how to drink a potion efficiently, such as by not using your hands, tossing it in the air and catching it in your mouth, or opening it with your teeth.

trait.Name: Adopted
trait.Benefit: Bonus Racial Trait from adoptive race of choice.
trait.Description: You were adopted and raised by someone not of your actual race, and raised in a society not your own. As a result, you picked up a race trait from your adoptive parents and society, and may immediately select a race trait from your adoptive parents’ race.

trait.Name: Aid Allies
trait.Benefit: When using the aid another action, you give your ally a +3 bonus instead of a +2 bonus.

trait.Name: Alchemical Prodigy
trait.Benefit: Choose one 1st-level spell from the bard, cleric, druid, or sorcerer/wizard spell list. If you have the Brew Potion feat, you may create potions of this spell as if it were on your spell list.
trait.Description: In your magical studies, you have learned to substitute the careful application of alchemical principles for spell knowledge.

trait.Name: Alluring
trait.Benefit: You receive a +2 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks with those who find you attractive. You can use daze once per day as a spell-like ability, with a caster level equal to your character level.
trait.Description: You have the art of turning a passing glance into love.

trait.Name: Andoren Freedom Fighter
trait.Benefit: +1 trait bonus on attack and damage rolls against slavers or any creature holding someone against their will.
trait.Description: You’ve dedicated your life to fighting against oppression, tyranny, and slavery.

trait.Name: Animal Friend
trait.Benefit: +1 trait bonus on Will saving throws as long as an animal (Tiny or larger, must be at least indifferent toward you) is within 30 feet, and Handle Animal is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You’ve long been a friend to many among Katapesh’s animal life, and feel safer when there are animals nearby.

trait.Name: Arcane Dabbler
trait.Benefit: Choose a 0-level arcane spell. You may cast that spell once per day as a spell-like ability. Your caster level is equal to your highest class level in a spellcasting class; if you have no caster level, it functions at CL 1st. The spell-like abilityâ€™s sa
trait.Description: Though your magical studies were decades ago, you still remember your favorite little trick.

trait.Name: Asmodean Demon Hunter
trait.Benefit: You gain a +3 trait bonus on Knowledge (planes) checks about demons and a +2 trait bonus on Will saves against mind-affecting spells and effects from demons.
trait.Description: Raised in the church of Asmodeus (whether or not you are currently a follower of the Prince of Darkness), youâ€™ve focused your indoctrinated fervor primarily on the elimination of demons.

trait.Name: Attuned to the Ancestors
trait.Benefit: Once per day, you can surround yourself with an aura of unlife. Unintelligent undead ignore you unless you take action against them, per hide from undead. The protection lasts for 1 round per two character levels you possess. If you take any offensive act
trait.Description: You were raised to believe that undead were nothing to fearâ€”they are simply the unliving remnants of your honored ancestors.

trait.Name: Augmented Disguise
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Disguise checks when wearing a wig, false beard, or similar large prop, or if you are wearing a special costume or eye-catching bauble that reinforces your disguise.
trait.Description: You are especially good at disguising yourself when you have props available.

trait.Name: Bastard
trait.Benefit: You take a –1 penalty on all Charisma-based skill checks made when dealing with members of Brevic nobility but gain a +1 trait bonus on Will saves as a result of your stubbornness and individuality. (The penalty aspect of this trait is removed if you ever
trait.Description: One of your parents was a member of one of the great families of Brevoy, perhaps even of the line of Rogarvia itself. Yet you have no substantive proof of your nobility, and you’ve learned that claiming nobility without evidence makes you as good as a lia

trait.Name: Beneficient Touch
trait.Benefit: Once per day, when you cast a spell or use a class ability that heals hit point damage, reroll any 1s that appear on the dice and take the new roll (even if it is another 1).

trait.Name: Blade of Mercy
trait.Benefit: You have trained long on martial techniques to use bladed weapons not to kill, but to subdue. When striking to inflict nonlethal damage with any slashing weapon, you do not take the normal â€“4 penalty on your attack roll, and gain a +1 trait bonus to any
trait.Description: You know that within the heart of even the most hateful and cruel living creature exists a sliver of shame and hope for redemption.

trait.Name: Blooded
trait.Benefit: You receive a +1 trait bonus on weapon damage rolls against giants, goblins, and orcs.
trait.Description: Desperate battles have honed your fighting skills against the ancient enemies of the dwarves.

trait.Name: Brigand
trait.Benefit: You also gain a +1 trait bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive checks when dealing with brigands, thieves, bandits, and their ilk.
trait.Description: You hail from the River Kingdoms or the more lawless reaches of Brevoy. Life has been hard for you. Perhaps your parents and siblings were crooks and con artists, or maybe your rough, lonely life lead you to fall in with thieves and worse. You know how to

trait.Name: Bullied
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on attacks of opportunity attack rolls made with unarmed strikes. Note that this trait does not grant the ability to make attacks of opportunity with your unarmed strikes—you’ll need to take a level of monk, the Improved Unarmed
trait.Description: You were bullied often as a child, and you are now constantly ready to defend yourself with your fists when an enemy comes near.

trait.Name: Canter
trait.Benefit: Anyone who attempts to use Bluff to deliver a secret message to you gains a +5 bonus on his Bluff check. When you attempt to intercept a secret message using Sense Motive, you gain a +5 trait bonus on the attempt.
trait.Description: You grew up among thieves and scoundrels, and their unusual speech patterns and turns of phrase don’t phase you in the slightest today as a result.

trait.Name: Charlaton
trait.Benefit: You may use this ability 3 times per day
trait.Description: Your talent for illusion goes beyond a mere knack for figments and phantasms. You can actually channel spell energy into simple illusions that augment your attempts at deception. As a swift action, you may expend one prepared spell or spell slot to gain a

trait.Name: Charming
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus when you use Bluff or Diplomacy on a character that is (or could be) sexually attracted to you, and a +1 trait bonus to the save DC of any language-dependent spell you cast on such characters or creatures

trait.Name: Child of Infamy
trait.Benefit: Furthermore, you’ve inherited some of your relative’s funds, and begin play with a nest egg of 300 gp that you can spend however you wish
trait.Description: Your family has long been in show business. Perhaps it was your parents, or an older sibling, or an uncle or aunt—whatever the case, one of your close relatives is, or was, a well-known and well-loved actor or actress. That this relation died in some comp

trait.Name: Child of Zolurket
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to weapon damage against undead
trait.Description: You come from a family whose ancestors worked in the platinum mines near Tar Urkatka, now known as Zolurket

trait.Name: Cleansing the Twisted
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to slashing weapon damage against all aberrations
trait.Description: You have studied well the many religious texts that chronicle Sarenrae’s neverending struggle against Rovagug and his monstrous offspring

trait.Name: Clearheaded
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on opposed checks against the Bluff and Disguise skills and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against illusion effects

trait.Name: Coin Hoarder
trait.Benefit: Your starting cash increases to 500 gp

trait.Name: Collector
trait.Benefit: Once this skill has been selected, it cannot be changed, nor can you gain it for any other collection you begin amassing
trait.Description: You have a small, bizarre collection of apparently worthless items, such as rusty nails, animal droppings, clockwork cogs, or bent spoons. You find this strange menagerie useful in ways no non-gnome could understand. Seeking new items to add to this colle

trait.Name: Dealmaker
trait.Benefit: If you went to a village and asked there, the DC would only be 20 because it’s only one community size away from a small town
trait.Description: You have the air of a person with money, allowing you to buy and sell valuables that otherwise are too rich for the local community. Once per week, when looking for an item with a price greater than the local community’s base value (see page 461 of the Pa

trait.Name: Deep Guardian
trait.Benefit: Any creature you conjure with a summon spell that has the earth subtype or a burrow speed gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and a +1 enhancement bonus to Armor Class for the duration of the spell that summoned it

trait.Name: Dervish
trait.Benefit: Dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most types of bonuses
trait.Description: You trained at a secret fighting school in Katheer where you learned the art of rapid movement in combat

trait.Name: Desert Child
trait.Benefit: You are accustomed to high temperatures and gain a +4 trait bonus on any saving throws made to resist the effects of being in hot conditions, and a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws against fire effects

trait.Name: Desert Shadow
trait.Benefit: When using the Stealth skill to move at full speed you no longer suffer a â€“5 penalty on your Stealth skill check

trait.Name: Devil's Mark
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on all Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive checks when dealing with outsiders of the evil subtype

trait.Name: Diabolical Dabbler
trait.Benefit: Each fiendish animal you conjure with any summon spell gains +1 hit point per hit die for the duration of the spell that summoned it.

trait.Name: Diabolist Raised
trait.Benefit: Your knowledge of diabolism grants you a +1 bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive checks made against Westcrown’s nobility, and a +1 bonus on all saving throws made against mindaffecting attacks from devils
trait.Description: All your life you’ve lived within the grip of devil-possessed Cheliax. You care little for the religion of your country, but that is the way of life in the most magnificent empire in the world, and who are you to question the faith of the empire’s rulers?

trait.Name: Dirty Fighter
trait.Benefit: This additional damage is a trait bonus
trait.Description: You wouldn’t have lived to make it out of childhood without the aid of a sibling, friend, or companion on whom you could always count to distract your enemies long enough to do a little bit more damage than normal

trait.Name: Divine Warrior
trait.Benefit: Your divine spells gain a +1 trait bonus to melee weapon damage
trait.Description: From an early age, you were trained by militaristic order of clerics

trait.Name: Dump Salvager
trait.Benefit: You gain a +3 trait bonus on Perception checks to search for concealed items

trait.Name: Dunewalker
trait.Benefit: You gain a +4 trait bonus on Fortitude checks to resist nonlethal damage from hot conditions and can always move through non-magical sand as if it were normal terrain

trait.Name: Duskwalker Agent
trait.Benefit: This discount also applies to your starting gear
trait.Description: You spent a portion of your childhood working for the Duskwalkers, the guild responsible for policing and watching over all trade that takes place in Katapesh’s notorious Nightstalls. You have quite a bit more spending cash than most others of your age as

trait.Name: Earthbound
trait.Benefit: While you are touching the ground, you add a +2 trait bonus to saving throw DCs and on caster level checks to overcome spell resistance for all spells you cast against creatures with the air subtype

trait.Name: Eastern Mysteries
trait.Benefit: You may increase the DC of that spell by +2
trait.Description: Ever since you were a young child, you studied the ancient arcane arts of several Eastern societies and those studies have made your spellcasting ability sometimes difficult to resist

trait.Name: Egorian School Apprentice
trait.Benefit: You gain a +3 trait bonus on Knowledge (engineering) checks and a +2 trait bonus on Perception checks to find secret doors or traps in buildings built in the Egorian School style

trait.Name: Eldritch Smith
trait.Benefit: This includes metal-handed weapons with nonmetal parts, such as axes and spears
trait.Description: You are learned in the secret lore of the forge, rituals handed down for generations that some say come from Torag himself

trait.Name: Elemental Pupil
trait.Benefit: When casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage of your chosen energy type, the spell deals 1 extra point of damage of this type
trait.Description: You have studied at the feet of the masters of Katheer’s colleges of magic, and so increased your own mastery of the elements

trait.Name: Expert Duelist
trait.Benefit: This trait bonus is not applied to your Armor Class for touch attacks or when denied your Dex bonus
trait.Description: In your youth, you spent countless hours perfecting the art of the duel, focusing your feints on defeating a single foe

trait.Name: Explorer
trait.Benefit: At the beginning of each level, you must select a new desired terrain type to replace the old one (you cannot take the same desired terrain type two levels in a row)
trait.Description: Though many gnomes settle down in communities large enough and interesting enough to provide them with all the stimulation they need to ward off the Bleaching, you’re never going to be one of them. You are always looking around the next bend in the road o

trait.Name: Fencer
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on attacks of opportunity made with daggers, swords, and similar bladed weapons

trait.Name: Fiendish Presence
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your family routinely held court with pit fiends and erinyes when you were a child, and as a result, you learned to manipulate people better than most

trait.Name: Finding Haleen
trait.Benefit: If multiple PCs take this trait, they should be siblings who were both protected and raised by Haleen
trait.Description: You never knew your parents—perhaps they died when you were a child, or maybe you were taken from them and raised elsewhere as a slave. You owe your sanity and your life to a woman named Haleen. She could be your sister or merely a childhood companion, bu

trait.Name: Fires of Hell
trait.Benefit: This is a supernatural ability
trait.Description: Your parents signed a pact with a fiend of Hell before you were born and you can summon fire to your aid. Once per day, as a swift action, you can summon fire, imbuing a single weapon you hold with a nimbus of fire that deals an extra 1 point of fire dama

trait.Name: First Memories
trait.Benefit: The DC for these spells is equal to 10 + the spell’s level + your Wisdom modifier
trait.Description: For your whole life, you’ve felt there was a world just beyond the fabric of the material objects around you, and sometimes you can hear the north wind calling you or smell the dread taint of polluted water before you taste it. You do not gain the normal

trait.Name: Flame of the Dawnflower
trait.Benefit: If you ever abandon the worship of Sarenrae, you immediately lose access to this trait’s benefits
trait.Description: You have been raised to view yourself as a blade in Sarenrae’s service, or have taken that duty on for yourself

trait.Name: Fools for Friends
trait.Benefit: Additionally, as long as one of your friends is within 30 feet, you gain a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws against charm and compulsion effects
trait.Description: You don’t think of yourself as a gambler. In fact, you rather detest the whole thing. Unfortunately, one or more of your friends (pick one or more of the other players’ characters) doesn’t think so, and you’ve recently learned that friend—or friends—have

trait.Name: Force For Good
trait.Benefit: This trait makes your aura more powerful (one step higher), as outlined in the detect evil spell

trait.Name: Fortified
trait.Benefit: Through alchemical techniques and endurance training, you gain the ability to negate a critical hit or sneak attack scored against you once per day

trait.Name: Freedom Fighter
trait.Benefit: If you do not possess the Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything feats, you still take penalties on these attack rolls as normal
trait.Description: You come from a family of farmers, but are determined to fight for your rights

trait.Name: Freedom Fighter
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on any skill check or attack roll made during the process of escaping capture or in helping a slave escape bondage, and Escape Artist is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Although halfling slaves are not as common in Katapesh as they are in Cheliax, they still make up a quarter of slaves sold at the Katapeshi Fleshfairs

trait.Name: Frostborn
trait.Prerequisites: Dwarf race (from Lands of the Linnorm Kings)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +4 trait bonus on any savings throws made to resist the effects of cold environments, as well as a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws against cold effects

trait.Name: Genie Blood
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against attacks that utilize that element (cold for air, acid for earth, fire for fire, and electricity for water), and gain a +1 trait bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive checks made against
trait.Description: One of your ancestors was genie-kind

trait.Name: Genie-Caller
trait.Benefit: Once per day, you may cast one conjuration (summoning) spell as if your caster level were 2 higher than normal

trait.Name: Ghost Sight
trait.Benefit: You receive a +2 trait bonus to Perception checks when trying to locate undead, and can attempt to locate ethereal undead (though they are still considered merely invisible, +20 to Stealth).

trait.Name: Gifted Adept
trait.Benefit: Pick one spell when you choose this trait—from this point on, whenever you cast that spell, its effects manifest at +1 caster level
trait.Description: Your interest in magic was inspired by witnessing a spell being cast in a particularly dramatic method, perhaps even one that affected you physically or spiritually

trait.Name: Gifted Adept
trait.Benefit: Pick one spell when you choose this traitâ€”from this point on, whenever you cast that spell, its effects manifest at +1 caster level
trait.Description: Your interest in magic was inspired by witnessing a spell being cast in a particularly dramatic method, perhaps even one that affected you physically or spiritually

trait.Name: Glory of Old
trait.Benefit: You receive a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against spells, spell-like abilities, and poison

trait.Name: Gnoll Killer
trait.Benefit: If you’re a spellcaster, you gain a +1 trait bonus to spell save DCs for damaging spells against gnolls
trait.Description: You grew up in rural Katapesh, in a region where gnoll activity was a fact of life. You killed your first gnoll at a young age when a group of gnoll slavers attacked your village, home, or caravan, and your hatred of gnolls has only grown since then. Some

trait.Name: Goldsniffer
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Perception checks related to metals, jewels, and gemstones

trait.Name: Greasy Palm
trait.Benefit: When bribing an NPC, you pay 10 percent less than a character without this trait would, garnering the same results

trait.Name: Hedge Magician
trait.Benefit: Whenever you craft a magic item, you reduce the cost of gp required to make the item by 5'%'

trait.Name: Heirloom Weapon
trait.Benefit: Note: You pay the standard gp cost for the weapon
trait.Description: You carry a non-masterwork simple or martial weapon that has been passed down from generation to generation in your family

trait.Name: Hellknight Ancestry
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks to influence Hellknights and a +2 trait bonus on Intimidate checks to influence enemies of the Hellknights

trait.Name: History of Heresy
trait.Benefit: As long as you do not possess any levels in a class that grants divine spellcasting power, you gain a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws made against divine spells
trait.Description: You were raised with heretical views that have made it not only difficult for you to accept most religious beliefs, but you also have had to live with the fact that you or those you love were often treated as pariahs

trait.Name: Honeyed Words
trait.Benefit: In addition, you receive a +1 trait bonus to the DC of any charm or compulsion that does not provide ongoing control and results in peaceful acts, such as calm emotions, sleep, or a suggestion to lay down arms
trait.Description: Your tact soothes bristling tempers and cools heated blood

trait.Name: Hunter's Blood
trait.Benefit: The undead have a +1 bonus on any roll to learn about you, as your family’s fame precedes you
trait.Description: You earn a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy when used to gather information, Knowledge (religion), and Survival when used for tracking when related to an undead quarry

trait.Name: Hunter's Eye
trait.Benefit: You do not suffer a penalty for the second range increment when using a longbow or shortbow and you are always considered proficient with one of these weapons (your choice)

trait.Name: I Know a Guy
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks made to gather information and a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (local) skill checks

trait.Name: Iadaran Illusionist
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on caster level checks with illusion spells and a +1 trait bonus on Will saves to disbelieve illusions

trait.Name: Impressive Presence
trait.Benefit: This condition persists for one round
trait.Description: Your grandiose sense of style often makes it difficult for anyone to be around you. Once per day as a full-round action, you may attempt to distract adjacent foes with a lengthy display of your martial prowess

trait.Name: Improvisational Equipment
trait.Benefit: Your GM may rule that some things are just not suitable for use in certain ways; for example, gluing a dead orc’s face to your own face won’t help you disguise yourself as an orc
trait.Description: You have an uncanny knack for turning equipment to new and unexpected uses. When using an item for anything other than its intended purpose—such as using a crowbar as a grappling hook or an old shirt to bandage a deadly wound—reduce the improvisation pena

trait.Name: Infernal Bastard
trait.Benefit: Likewise, you do not have the ability to use darkness as a spell-like ability once per day—instead, you may choose any one 0-level spell that you can instead use at will as a spell-like ability
trait.Description: You are a tiefling. You might be an escaped slave, a hidden shame, or a homeless vagabond, but whatever your upbringing, life has been particularly hard on you. You have suffered greatly, nearly starving to death one winter, nearly being beaten to death b

trait.Name: Iron Liver
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Fortitude saves against poison and drugs, and a +4 trait bonus on Fortitude saves to avoid the effects of alcohol

trait.Name: Killer
trait.Benefit: This extra damage is a trait bonus
trait.Description: You made your first kill at a very young age and found the task of war or murder to your liking. You either take particular pride in a well-placed blow, or vile pleasure in such a strike as you twist the blade to maximize the pain

trait.Name: Kyonin Gatekeeper
trait.Benefit: You know the proper commands to operate a particular elf gate (most likely an often used elf gate, but at the GM’s discretion it may be a less popular or out-of-the-way elf gate)
trait.Description: You helped maintain the elf gates and are familiar with the operation of teleportation magic

trait.Name: Lapsed Faith
trait.Benefit: The save DC is Wisdom-based
trait.Description: You still remember a few prayers from your past experience serving in a temple

trait.Name: Latent Psion
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on saves against mindaffecting effects
trait.Description: The power to affect the world with the mind is very much a reality in your distant homeland

trait.Name: Left Behind
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy and Gather Information checks when interacting with Forlorn elves and non-elf races

trait.Name: Lost Nobility
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on attack and damage rolls against government officials of your homeland
trait.Description: Your family was prominent before the rise of Thrune, but that legacy is now forgotten by all but you

trait.Name: Loyalty
trait.Benefit: You resist attempts to dissuade you from the Decemvirate’s will. You gain a +1 trait bonus on saves against enchantment spells and spell-like abilities

trait.Name: Magic is Life
trait.Benefit: If you are reduced to negative hit points while you are under the effects of any spell, you automatically confirm stabilization checks to stop bleeding
trait.Description: Your faith in magic allows you to reflexively use the energy of any spell effect on you to save you from death

trait.Name: Magical Knack
trait.Benefit: Pick a class when you gain this trait—your caster level in that class gains a +2 trait bonus as long as this bonus doesn’t increase your caster level higher than your current HitDiceRoll
trait.Description: You were raised, either wholly or in part, by a magical creature, either after it found you abandoned in the woods or because your parents often left you in the care of a magical minion

trait.Name: Magical Lineage
trait.Benefit: When you apply metamagic feats to this spell, treat its actual level as 1 lower for determining the spell’s final adjusted level
trait.Description: One of your parents was a gifted spellcaster who not only used metamagic often, but developed many magical items and perhaps even a new spell or two—and you have inherited a fragment of this greatness

trait.Name: Magical Talent
trait.Benefit: The spell-like ability’s save DC is Charisma-based
trait.Description: Either from inborn talent, whimsy of the gods, or obsessive study of strange tomes, you have mastered the use of a cantrip. Choose a 0-level spell. You may cast that spell once per day as a spell-like ability

trait.Name: Master of Pentacles
trait.Benefit: Once per day, when casting a spell of the Conjuration school, you are at +2 caster level when determining the duration of the spell

trait.Name: Masterful Demeanor
trait.Benefit: You gain a +3 trait bonus on Intimidate checks against members of non-human humanoid races

trait.Name: Medic
trait.Benefit: Additionally, your caster level is considered one higher when casting spells of the healing subschool with remove in the spell’s name

trait.Name: Meridian Strike
trait.Benefit: Once per day when you roll damage on a successful critical hit, reroll any 1s and take the new roll (even if it is another 1)

trait.Name: Meticulous Artisian
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Craft checks

trait.Name: Mordant Heritage
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against enchantment effects

trait.Name: Mummy-Touched
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on saving throws versus diseases and curses

trait.Name: Natural-Born Leader
trait.Benefit: If you ever take the Leadership feat, you gain a +1 trait bonus to your Leadership score
trait.Description: You've always found yourself in positions where others look up to you as a leader, and you can distinctly remember an event from your early childhood where you led several other children to accomplish a goal that each of you individually could not

trait.Name: Naturally Gifted
trait.Benefit: This does not always have to be the same spell-like ability—one day you might use dancing lights twice, only to use the additional casting for speak with animals the next day
trait.Description: For unknown reasons, you have deeper reserves of magical energy than those around you. Perhaps you are descended from a family of powerful arcane casters, or maybe you believe this trait marks you as destined for magical greatness

trait.Name: Noble Born Garess
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Appraise checks to assess the value of natural stones or metals
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Noble Born Medvyed
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on all Diplomacy checks made to deal with fey creatures and a +1 trait bonus on Will saves made against their spells and supernatural abilities
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Noble Born Surtova
trait.Benefit: You deal +2 damage when attacking a flat-footed opponent while wielding a light or one-handed weapon
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Nonchalant Thuggery
trait.Benefit: You gain a +4 trait bonus on Bluff checks to keep others from noticing your aggressive actions

trait.Name: Observant
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all related checks, and the chosen skill is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Sometimes it helps to pay attention to your surroundings and the people you meet

trait.Name: Optimistic Gambler
trait.Benefit: Effects that grant you morale bonuses persist 1d4 rounds longer than they normally would as a result
trait.Description: You’ve always seemed to have trouble keeping money. Worse, you always seem to have debts looming over your head. When you heard about the “Cheat the Devil and Take His Gold” gambling tournament, you felt in your gut that your luck was about to change. You

trait.Name: Patient Optimist
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks to influence hostile or unfriendly creatures, and if you fail at such an attempt you may retry it once

trait.Name: Performance Artist
trait.Benefit: This bonus increases to +5 when using that Perform skill to make money
trait.Description: As a youth, you studied in the avant garde theatre scene of Oppara. Your performance skills have been known to bring even the toughest crowd to their feet. Choose one type of Perform skill

trait.Name: Perseverance
trait.Benefit: When you have more than 1 Will saving throw to overcome an effect (such as greater command, hold person, or by using the good fortune ability of the Luck domain), you receive a +3 trait bonus on the extra Will saves against that effect

trait.Name: Pesh Addict
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: You spent several of your teenaged years addicted to pesh, a habit that you may or may not have kicked. Certainly, the habit consumed much of your savings

trait.Name: Power of Suggestion
trait.Benefit: This deception lasts 1 minute; if the item is still in view, the observers may recognize their error unless you make another bluff check
trait.Description: People trust your words over their own eyes. You may make a Bluff check to make observers believe that an object in your possession is actually a different object entirely. The DC for the check is 20 for items of a similar size, shape, and color (such as

trait.Name: Precocious Spellcaster
trait.Benefit: Select one cantrip and one 1st-level spell; when you cast these spells, they function at one caster level higher than your actual caster level
trait.Description: Before you even began your training as a spellcaster, you spent a great deal of time studying cantrips and simple spells on your own

trait.Name: Prehensile Whip
trait.Benefit: Attaching your whip is a standard action, but detaching it is a full-round action
trait.Description: In your hand a whip has a life of its own, wrapping around pillars and beams with ease

trait.Name: Prismati Player
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on attack rolls with fistsized rocks or similarly shaped objects, and a +1 trait bonus on concentration checks

trait.Name: Quick Learner
trait.Benefit: This effect lasts only while you have the weapon in hand; you must “relearn” the weapon each time you pick it up
trait.Description: You’re skilled at learning the feel of a particular weapon after a few swings in combat

trait.Name: Rapscallion
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Escape Artist checks and a +1 trait bonus to initiative checks
trait.Description: You’ve spent your entire life thumbing your nose at the establishment and take pride in your run-ins with the law

trait.Name: Reclaiming your Roots
trait.Benefit: If you ever lose this item, your resulting depression imposes a –1 penalty on Will saves for 1 year
trait.Description: Your interest in the village of Kelmarane is more personal than most of the others who are heading out to aid in the reclamation. You aren’t seeking revenge against gnolls, glory, money, or anything else—to you, this is purely a matter of honor, as Kelmar

trait.Name: Researching the Blot
trait.Benefit: The DC to identify a magic item is equal to 20 + the item’s caster level
trait.Description: You may or may not be seeking membership into Riddleport’s most prestigious magical guild, the Order of Cyphers, but you certainly have heard their call for aid in determining the nature of the strange shadow in the sky above Riddleport. You arrived in to

trait.Name: Resigned
trait.Benefit: You receive a +1 trait bonus when retrying a previously failed skill check or ability check, as well as when taking 20 on skill checks and ability checks
trait.Description: Existence is little more than unending toil

trait.Name: Rich Parents
trait.Benefit: You were born into a rich family, perhaps even the nobility, and even though you turned to a life of adventure anyway, you enjoyed a one-time benefit to your initial finances and your starting cash increases to 900 gp.

trait.Name: Rider of Paresh
trait.Benefit: You must have the Mounted Combat feat to take this trait
trait.Description: You call the Plains of Paresh home, whether you were born among the plains’ tribes or in the glittering towers of Katheer. The horses are your kin

trait.Name: Rough and Ready
trait.Benefit: This trait is commonly used with shovels, picks, blacksmith hammers, and other sturdy tools — lutes and brooms make terribly fragile weapons
trait.Description: Your intense familiarity with the tools of your trade allows you to use them in combat as if they were actual weapons and makes them more effective for that purpose than they would normally be

trait.Name: Sacred Avenger
trait.Benefit: If this creature is your ilduliel (see page 8), this bonus increases to +2
trait.Description: You have a special connection between you and Calistria that enhances your ability to achieve vengeance

trait.Name: Sacred Conduit
trait.Benefit: Whenever you channel energy, you gain a +1 trait bonus to the save DC of your channeled energy
trait.Description: Your birth was particularly painful and difficult for your mother, who needed potent divine magic to ensure you survived; your mother may or may not have survived

trait.Name: Sacred Touch
trait.Benefit: As a standard action, you may automatically stabilize a dying creature merely by touching it

trait.Name: Scouting for Fiends
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all attack rolls made against foes you know to be evil outsiders
trait.Description: You belong to an organization (most likely a religion) that has definite views on the menace posed by the lower planes. The willfulness with which the city of Korvosa (they even allow a temple of Asmodeus to operate in broad daylight!) tolerates infernal

trait.Name: Secrets of the Sphinx
trait.Benefit: Additionally, choose one Knowledge skill—this skill becomes a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your ancestors paid the proper obeisance to Nethys, who granted their heirs special divinatory gifts

trait.Name: Seeking Adventure
trait.Benefit: A wayfinder is a magical compass that grants you a +2 circumstance bonus on Survival checks to avoid becoming lost, and can be commanded to emit light as the spell (CL 5th) as a standard action
trait.Description: The Pathfinder Society has long intrigued you—tales of the exotic lands and strange discoveries made by Pathfinders have enchanted your dreams and fired your imagination since childhood. When Pathfinders came through your village or neighborhood, they imm

trait.Name: Shadow Child
trait.Benefit: When attacking targets in areas of dim light, you do not suffer the standard 20'%' miss chance on attack rolls for being in the poorly lit area
trait.Description: Westcrown has long suffered under a peculiar curse, a blight that rises every night, bringing with it fell beasts that hunt the shadows. No one can say from whence these night-horrors come—though some blame the mysterious wizards of Nidal, other claim tha

trait.Name: Shiv
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on damage rolls made with one-handed piercing or slashing weapons in a surprise round

trait.Name: Skeptic
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on all saving throws against illusions

trait.Name: Soul-Drinker
trait.Benefit: These temporary hit points last for 1 minute
trait.Description: There is a dark hunger in you that rejoices when you or your allies slay a foe. Once per day as a swift action, you may gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the Hit Dice of your most recent enemy slain

trait.Name: Sprint
trait.Benefit: If you do nothing but move in a turn (that is, if you run or use both of your actions in a round to move your speed) and you are in no armor or light armor, you may move an extra 5 feet
trait.Description: You were taught from a young age that the world is full of big, fast, dangerous foes, and that sometimes the best course of action is to put your head down and run

trait.Name: Stage Magic
trait.Benefit: The item is expended without its normal effects and only serves to make your performance more impressive; for example, you could pretend to ignite yourself with alchemist’s fire as part of a Perform (comedy) check or make a dramatic appearance with a smok
trait.Description: You have put in many hours practicing with flashy alchemical items that enhance your performances

trait.Name: Starchild
trait.Benefit: You gain a +4 trait bonus on Survival checks to avoid becoming lost
trait.Description: The Song of the Spheres sensed your love of travel and promised you would always be able to find your way home

trait.Name: Stealthy Escape
trait.Benefit: If you free yourself, you gain a +2 trait bonus on Bluff checks to pretend that you are still bound
trait.Description: You are adept at escaping from confinement in an unobtrusive manner

trait.Name: Storyteller
trait.Benefit: You can make this check even if you do not have ranks in the required Knowledge skill
trait.Description: The long travels between the Inner Sea and Tian Xia have exposed you to a wide variety of campfire tales

trait.Name: Strength of the Land
trait.Benefit: This includes dispel checks and checks to overcome spell resistance
trait.Description: You are able to tap into the living energy of the world to shatter lesser magic

trait.Name: Strength of the Sun
trait.Benefit: During the day, you gain a +1 trait bonus on all Charisma-based checks

trait.Name: Strong Arm, Supple Wrist
trait.Benefit: You can only gain this benefit once per round
trait.Description: You have been trained in the javelin and the spear, and know how to make the best use of your momentum

trait.Name: Sword Scion
trait.Benefit: You begin play with a longsword or Aldori dueling sword and gain a +1 trait bonus on all attacks and combat maneuvers made with such weapons
trait.Description: You have lived all your life in and around the city of Restov, growing up on tales of Baron Sirian Aldori and the exploits of your home city’s heroic and legendary swordlords. Perhaps one of your family members was an Aldori swordlord, you have a contact

trait.Name: Teaching Mistake
trait.Benefit: Once per scenario, when you roll a natural 1 on any saving throw, you gain a +1 trait bonus on your next saving throw, used before the end of the scenario

trait.Name: The City Protects
trait.Benefit: If you are a paladin, this ability to make additional saves to overcome fear extends to all allies within your aura of courage
trait.Description: You feel safe and secure in urban environments, even in cities whose laws you find unjust—it is the physical fact of the city that you take solace in. In any settlement, you gain a +2 trait bonus against fear effects

trait.Name: The Pathfinder’s Exile
trait.Benefit: Further details on the Pathfinder Society and wayfinders can be found in the Pathfinder Campaign Setting or Pathfinder Chronicles: Seekers of Secrets
trait.Description: Westcrown’s dilapidated Pathfinder lodge of Delvehaven has long excited your imagination. Forcibly closed by the order of the city’s diabolical rulers, the Pathfinders of Westcrown were exiled, forcing them to leave behind untold knowledge and the treasur

trait.Name: Threatening Defender
trait.Benefit: When you use Combat Expertise, reduce the number you subtract from your melee attack rolls by 1

trait.Name: Thrown-Together Fashion
trait.Benefit: The alteration takes 10 minutes per 1-gp difference in the cost of the outfits
trait.Description: You can modify old clothing to make it effective in new circumstances. With a basic sewing kit or disguise kit, you can make a Disguise check to change one outfit into another outfit (see page 159 of the Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook, or page 13 of this bo

trait.Name: Toilcrafter
trait.Benefit: These items cannot be upgraded with new abilities
trait.Description: You can craft passable if inferior magical weapons, armors, and shields through diligence and toil. Choose one Craft or Profession skill in which you have at least 1 rank. Ranks in your chosen skill count as your caster level for the purpose of qualifying

trait.Name: Treerazer’s Bane
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on weapon damage against demons, evil fey, and plants and animals corrupted by evil.
trait.Description: Having fought in many battles against Treerazer and his minions, you have learned the best ways to kill the various creatures under his control.

trait.Name: Trickster
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to your caster level when determining the duration, range, and area of all spells from the illusion school.

trait.Name: Tunnel Fighter
trait.Benefit: While underground, you receive a +2 trait bonus to initiative checks and a +1 trait bonus on weapon damage rolls for critical hits (this damage is multiplied on a critical hit)

trait.Name: Tusked
trait.Benefit: Gain a bite attack.
trait.Description: Huge, sharp tusks bulge from your mouth, and you receive a bite attack.

trait.Name: Unorthodox Strategy
trait.Benefit: You are particularly quick on your feet, and gain a +2 trait bonus on Acrobatics checks made to move through an enemy’s threatened squares

trait.Name: Vindictive
trait.Benefit: You receive a +1 trait bonus on damage rolls against a single adjacent opponent who damaged you in the previous round of combat

trait.Name: Walking Ward
trait.Benefit: Choose one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire; you gain a +1 bonus on saving throws against spells that deal damage of this type or have this subtype

trait.Name: Warrior Poet
trait.Prerequisites: Dwarf race (from Lands of the Linnorm Kings)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge checks related to dwarves (dwarven history, dwarven construction, and so on) and a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saves in any round in which you use a bardic performance ability.
trait.Description: You were trained by the skalds, keepers of the oral tradition of Kalsgard.

trait.Name: Warsmith
trait.Benefit: Knowledge (engineering) is a class skill for you
trait.Description: You have an intuitive grasp of the weak points of metal and stone

trait.Name: Wasp Whisperer
trait.Benefit: You may make Diplomacy checks to improve a Hostile or Unfriendly insectile vermin’s attitude toward Indifferent
trait.Description: Your association with Calistria’s church has toughened your flesh against venom and blessed you with the ability to influence wasps and similar insectile vermin

trait.Name: Wealthy Dabbler
trait.Benefit: If you have levels in a class that can cast these cantrips, your caster level for these cantrips is equal to that class level
trait.Description: You study magic at a social club, wowing your friends with your recent discoveries and showing off your expertise in the simplest of magical exploits. Select two non-harmful arcane cantrips

trait.Name: Weapon Style
trait.Benefit: You gain proficiency in one weapon normally used by monks, such as kama, nunchaku, sai, or shuriken.

trait.Name: Wharf Rat
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on skill checks involving climbing and rope use, and a +4 trait bonus on Appraise checks to determine the value of large quantities of bulk goods without opening their containers.
trait.Description: You may never have been on a boat larger than a garbage scow, but youâ€™ve been helping them dock all your life.

trait.Name: Whisper Woods Hunter
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Survival checks to track evil outsiders and a +2 trait bonus on initiative checks when you know your opponent is an evil outsider.
trait.Description: Your family prepared you for a life of evading or destroying fiendish creatures.

trait.Name: Wisdom in the Flesh
trait.Benefit: That skill is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your meditation on the nature of strength and speed allows you to focus your thoughts to achieve things your body might not be able to do on its own. Select any Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity-based skill

trait.Name: Without a Past
trait.Benefit: You earn +1 trait bonus to Bluff and Linguistics when used to forge documents, and choose one as a class skill.

trait.Name: Zest for Battle
trait.Benefit: Whenever you have a morale bonus to weapon attack rolls, you also receive a +1 trait bonus on weapon damage rolls

trait.Name: Ambassador
trait.Benefit: +2 trait bonus to Diplomacy checks.
trait.Description: Your natural abilities at mediation and compromise manifested at a young age. For as long as you can remember, you were always more able to solve disputes and carefully settle violent disagreements than others.

trait.Name: Anatomist
trait.Benefit: +1 trait bonus on all rolls made to confirm critical hits.
trait.Description: You have studied the workings of anatomy, either as a student at university or as an apprentice mortician or necromancer. You know where to aim your blows to strike vital organ.

trait.Name: Armor Expert
trait.Benefit: When you wear armor of any sort, reduce that suit’s armor check penalty by 1, to a minimum check penalty of 0
trait.Description: You have worn armor as long as you can remember, either as part of your training to become a knight’s squire or simply because you were seeking to emulate a hero

trait.Name: Aspiring Bard
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to one category of Perform checks and a +2 trait bonus to any Knowledge (local) checks that deal with the Oppara music scene.
trait.Description: You spent countless hours of your youth wandering the open campuses of the Kitharodian Academy and the Rhapsodic College, listening to wonderful musicians and singers and daydreaming of your life as a bard.

trait.Name: Azlant Fanatic
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Knowledge (arcana) and Knowledge (history) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: Your years spent in libraries reading every musty tome you could find about the ancient lost civilization of Azlant have given you insight into the subjects of history and the arcane.

trait.Name: Bad Reputation
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Intimidate checks, and Intimidate becomes a class skill for you.
trait.Description: The reputation of the Sczarni precedes your arrival.

trait.Name: Battlefield Caster
trait.Prerequisites: Dwarf race (follower of Angradd, Gorum, Torag, or Trudd)
trait.Benefit: You receive a +1 trait bonus on concentration checks to cast defensively and a +1 trait bonus to AC against attacks provoked by or readied against spellcasting.
trait.Description: Your faith protects you even as you unleash spells in the thick of battle.

trait.Name: Birthmark
trait.Benefit: you gain a +2 trait bonus on all saving throws against charm and compulsion effects as a result.
trait.Description: You were born with a strange birthmark that looks very similar to the holy symbol of the god you chose to worship later in life. This birthmark can serve you as a divine focus for casting spells, and, as a physical manifestation of your faith, increases y

trait.Name: Brastlewark Businessman
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on all Craft (alchemy) checks.
trait.Description: Your time among the Brastlewark elite has led to an extensive knowledge of alchemy and ready connections in the trade.

trait.Name: Brute
trait.Benefit: +2 trait bonus on Intimidate checks.
trait.Description: You have spent long hours working for a crime lord, either as a low-level enforcer or as a guard or bouncer. You're adept at frightening away people

trait.Name: Bully
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Intimidate checks, and Intimidate is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You grew up in an environment where the meek were ignored and you often had to resort to threats or violence to be heard.

trait.Name: Calistrian Prostitute
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Gather Information and Sense Motive checks.
trait.Description: You worked in one of Calistria’s temples as a sacred prostitute, and you know how to flatter, please, and (most of all) listen.

trait.Name: Captain's Blade
trait.Benefit: While on board any vessel afloat on water, you gain a +1 trait bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You were born on board a ship and learned to fight beside the sailing men and women of the Andoren fleet.

trait.Name: Carefully Hidden
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Will saves and a +2 trait bonus to saving throws versus divination effects.
trait.Description: Modern Taldor is not kind to Keleshites. Your life as a member of an unpopular ethnic group has given you an uncanny knack for avoiding detection.

trait.Name: Caretaker
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Heal checks, and Heal is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Child of the Street
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sleight of Hand checks, and Sleight of Hand is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Child of the Temple
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (nobility and royalty) and Knowledge (religion) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Chivalrous
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Diplomacy and Knowledge (history) checks

trait.Name: Classically Schooled
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Spellcraft checks, and Spellcraft is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Cliff Jumper
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks, and on Reflex saves to avoid falling

trait.Name: Comparative Religion
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (religion) skill checks, and Knowledge (religion) becomes a class skill for you

trait.Name: Conspiracy Hunter
trait.Benefit: Choose one of the following skills: Bluff, Diplomacy, Knowledge (local), Perception, Sense Motive, or Stealth. You gain a +1 trait bonus on this skill and it is always considered a class skill for you
trait.Description: You’ve long heard rumors of dark deeds afoot in Westcrown. Shipments of valuable cargo that go missing with nary a trace or question asked. People who disappear as though they never existed. Lords of business and nobles who speak in veiled references and

trait.Name: Courageous
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against fear effects

trait.Name: Courageous
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against fear effects

trait.Name: Dangerously Curious
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Use Magic Device checks, and Use Magic Device is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: You have always been intrigued by magic, possibly because you were the child of a magician or priest

trait.Name: Deep Marker
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Survival checks, and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against fear effects

trait.Name: Deft Dodger
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Reflex saves

trait.Name: Desperate Focus
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on concentration checks

trait.Name: Devotee of a Dead God
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks and Knowledge (religion) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You simply cannot and will not accept that Aroden is dead. Your faith in his teachings and religion are stronger than ever

trait.Name: Devotee of the Green
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (geography) and Knowledge (nature) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Dilettante Artist
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Art for you is a social gateway and you use it to influence and penetrate high society

trait.Name: Earning Your Freedom
trait.Benefit: Choose one of the three categories of saving throw; you gain a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws of that type
trait.Description: You’ve been a slave your whole life, and have passed from master to master more times than you can count. Some of those masters were cruel, others kindly. In all cases, you’ve yearned to be free. When your most recent master fell on hard times, he sold ma

trait.Name: Ease of Faith
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Diplomacy checks, and Diplomacy is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your mentor, the person who invested your faith in you from an early age, took steps to ensure that you understood that what powers your divine magic is no different than that which powers the magic of other religions

trait.Name: Elven Reflexes
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Initiative checks

trait.Name: Etymologist
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Linguistics checks, know one additional bonus language, and treat Linguistics as a class skill
trait.Description: When you, like all other young gnomes, were taught the hodgepodge Gnome language, you became curious about the original meaning of each word and what language it was derived from

trait.Name: Excitable
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Initiative checks
trait.Description: You demand that everything must happen right now, no matter what, and are too impatient to wait for everyone else to catch up. You finish people’s sentences, blurt out the punch lines to slowly-told jokes, rarely make plans, and leap headlong into anythin

trait.Name: Explorer
trait.Benefit: Your family heritage is filled with proud and renowned explorers, and you are a natural wayfinder. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Survival checks, and Survival is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Extremely Fashionable
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is a class skill for you
trait.Description: You really know how to make a good impression when you’re dressed well

trait.Name: Eyes and Ears of the City
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Perception checks

trait.Name: Failed Apprentice
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to saves against arcane spells
trait.Description: As a child, your parents sent you to a distant wizard’s tower as an apprentice so that you might learn the arcane arts

trait.Name: Fanatic
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your years spent in libraries reading every musty tome you could find about ancient lost civilizations has given you insight into the subjects of history and the arcane

trait.Name: Fashionable
trait.Benefit: So long as you are wearing clothing and jewelry worth more than 80 gp, you gain a +1 trait bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, and Sense Motive checks

trait.Name: Fast-Talker
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Bluff checks, and Bluff is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Focused Mind
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on concentration checks

trait.Name: Forlorn
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saving throws
trait.Description: There are no major elven settlements in Katapesh, and like many of the region’s elves, you were forced to grow up among shorter-lived races like humanity

trait.Name: Framed (Dropout)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Spellcraft checks
trait.Description: You were the one accused. Although you were eventually freed when a friend confronted the fisherman and got the truth, the damage had been done. You were forced to leave your school (perhaps the Acadamae) or church

trait.Name: Framed (Family Honor)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Bluff checks
trait.Description: The person framed was a family member, perhaps a father or brother

trait.Name: Freed Slave
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saves
trait.Description: You spent a significant portion of your childhood as a slave, but were freed from slavery several years ago by a benevolent master who purchased you from an auction after your previous master’s death

trait.Name: Freedom Fighter
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Stealth checks and a +1 trait bonus on attack rolls made during the surprise round

trait.Name: Goldfinger
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand checks, and one of these skills (your choice) becomes a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your family comes from a long, proud tradition of housebreaking and thievery

trait.Name: Grounded
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on balance-related Acrobatics checks, and a +1 trait bonus on Reflex saves

trait.Name: Guardian of the Forge
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is a class skill for you
trait.Description: Torag’s sacred duties are to protect the faithful, take lessons from the great craftsmen and strategists of the past, and prepare against dark times

trait.Name: Historian
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (history) checks and bardic knowledge checks, and Knowledge (history) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Horse Lord
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Ride checks, and the Ride skill becomes a class skill for you

trait.Name: Indomitable
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on saving throws versus enchantment spells and effects

trait.Name: Indomitable Faith
trait.Benefit: Your constant struggle to maintain your own faith has bolstered your drive; you gain a +1 trait bonus on Will saves as a result

trait.Name: Infernal Influence
trait.Benefit: You gain fire resistance 1 and a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saves against poison

trait.Name: Insider Knowledge
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all related checks, and the chosen skill is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Venture-Captain Valsin likes to keep abreast of situations within the Pathfinder Society, and you do your best to emulate him

trait.Name: Into Enemy Territory
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws of that type
trait.Description: The shadow in the sky is visible from all around Riddleport, not just in town. It’s certainly come to the attention of several druids, rangers, and other rural folk who dwell in the nearby mountains, forests, and swamps—among them, yourself. You’ve consul

trait.Name: Issan
trait.Benefit: Your agile mind grants you a +1 trait bonus on all Will saves made to resist mind-affecting effects
trait.Description: You were raised northern Brevoy, a land of misty shores and harsh hill lands, of snowy vistas and violet-hued mountains. You are descended from an able and intelligent people, and you have grand ambitions, a mind alert for opportunity, and the tenacity to

trait.Name: Keeper of the Veil
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 competence bonus on Bluff and Disguise checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Keleshite Princess
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Diplomacy and Intimidate checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Kobold's Neighbor
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus to Perception checks to discover traps and a +1 trait bonus to Disable Device checks
trait.Description: You grew up in wilderness where kobolds make their homes

trait.Name: Legacy of Sand
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all Will saving throws
trait.Description: A large tribe of orcs adapted to life in the desert once dwelt in southeastern Katapesh. Although this tribe is long extinct, some half-orcs of Katapesh carry the traits of this tribe in their particularly large jaws, broad shoulders, and shockingly pale

trait.Name: Looking for Work
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus in that skill, and that skill is always considered a class skill for you
trait.Description: Although out of work, you aren’t particularly keen on the prospect of gambling away your last remaining coins simply for a chance at riches. That said, if the Gold Goblin’s fortunes reverse after this big gambling tournament, you’re relatively certain its

trait.Name: Love Lost (Orphaned)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on one of the following skills: Craft, Perform, or Profession
trait.Description: The murder victim was your only surviving parent

trait.Name: Love Lost (Widowed)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks
trait.Description: The murder victim was a lover

trait.Name: Mathematical Prodigy
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Knowledge (arcana) and Knowledge (engineering) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Merchant of Katheer
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Appraise checks, and Appraise is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Merchant’s Child
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Appraise checks, and Appraise is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Militant Merchant
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Perception checks made to determine surprise, and Perception is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: You know what it takes to get your goods to market and will stop at nothing to protect your products

trait.Name: Militia Veteran
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on that skill, and it is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your first job was serving in a civilian militia in your home town. Skills learned while daily drilling and protecting your fellow townsfolk gave you special insight into military life

trait.Name: Mind Over Matter
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Will saving throws

trait.Name: Missing Child (Sibling)
trait.Benefit: Diplomacy (gather information) and Sense Motive are always class skills for you
trait.Description: The missing child is a brother or sister. Although everyone else has given up hope, you believe your sibling still lives out there

trait.Name: Missing Child (Son or Daughter)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Will saves
trait.Description: The missing child is your own son or daughter, a niece or nephew, or the son or daughter of your superior or employer and one you had been charged with protecting. The child was abducted during a trip to the market or some other daily event

trait.Name: Missionary
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks using that skill, and it is always considered a class skill for you
trait.Description: You’ve spent much of the last several years serving your faith, and the conviction and dedication to your church has impressed many. Perhaps you’ve donated much of your personal wealth or time to serving the church, or you’re the child of a powerful or we

trait.Name: Narrows Survivor
trait.Benefit: Sense Motive is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: You spent your childhood in the infamous Narrows district of Oppara. Years of living in violent squalor have sharpened your senses and given you an ardent distrust of humanity

trait.Name: Nightstall Urchin
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on saves against fear effects, and when you do make a successful save against a fear effect, the resulting rush of bravado grants you a +1 trait bonus on attack rolls and all skill checks for the next minute
trait.Description: You grew up an orphan on the streets of Katapesh, and spent many years of childhood in the Nightstalls, Katapesh’s most infamous market

trait.Name: Noble Born Lebeda
trait.Benefit: You gain a bonus language: Dwarven, Elven, Hallit, Gnome, Giant, Halfling, Skald, or Sylvan
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Noble Born Lodovka
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks, and Swim is always treated as a class skill for you
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Noble Born Orlovsky
trait.Benefit: In addition, choose Acrobatics, Diplomacy, or Stealth—you gain a +1 trait bonus on this skill
trait.Description: You claim a tangential but legitimate connection to one of Brevoy’s noble families. If you aren’t human, you were likely adopted by one of Brevoy’s nobles or were instead a favored servant or even a childhood friend of a noble scion. Whatever the cause, y

trait.Name: Outcast
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Survival skill checks, and Survival is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Pesh Dealer
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sleight of Hand checks, and Sleight of Hand is always a class skill for you.

trait.Name: Pesh Drug Addict (addicted friend)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (local) checks or Diplomacy (gather information) checks (choose one when selecting this trait).

trait.Name: Pesh Drug Addict (personal addiction)
trait.Benefit: +1 bonus on Fortitude saving throws.

trait.Name: Pioneer
trait.Benefit: Also, choose one of the following skills: Climb, Handle Animal, Knowledge (nature), Perception, Ride, Survival, or Swim—you gain a +1 trait bonus on this skill

trait.Name: Poverty-Stricken
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to Survival checks, and Survival is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your childhood was tough, and your parents had to make every copper piece count

trait.Name: Proper Training
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on all related checks, and the chosen skill is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Reactionary
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus to Initiative checks
trait.Description: You were bullied often as a child, but never quite developed an offensive response

trait.Name: Resilient
trait.Benefit: You’ve built up your mettle as a result, and gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saves

trait.Name: River Rat
trait.Benefit: +1 damage with dagger , broken. Swim is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: You learned to swim right after you learned to walk. As a youth, a gang of river pirates put you to work swimming in nighttime rivers and canals with a dagger in your teeth so you could sever the anchor ropes of merchant vessels

trait.Name: Rostlander
trait.Benefit: Your hardy nature grants you a +1 trait bonus on all Fortitude saves.

trait.Name: Ruthless
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on attack rolls to confirm critical hits

trait.Name: Savannah Child
trait.Benefit: Pick one of the following skills: Handle Animal, Knowledge (nature), or Ride. You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You were born and raised in central Katapesh, among the rolling savannahs that dominate the nation’s interior. You spent many of your youth exploring these vast reaches, and know much of the savannah’s secrets

trait.Name: Scholar of Ruins
trait.Benefit: One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: From the moment you could walk and talk, the ruins of Taldor fascinated you. You joined every expedition you could find, volunteered as a porter for the Pathfinder Society, and sometimes just set out on your own to explore as many of the Taldan ruins as y

trait.Name: Scholar of the Great Beyond
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (history) and Knowledge (planes) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you
trait.Description: Your great interests as a child did not lie with current events or the mundane— you have always felt out of place, as if you were born in the wrong era

trait.Name: Seeker of Brightness
trait.Benefit: Choose a Knowledge skill; you gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge checks of that type and on Search checks

trait.Name: Shadow Diplomat
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks, and Diplomacy becomes a class skill for you.

trait.Name: Shield Bearer
trait.Benefit: You retain your shield bonus to your armor class when using this ability
trait.Description: Benefit When performing a shield bash, you deal 1 additional point of damage. Also, once per day on your turn as a free action, you may provide one adjacent ally a +2 trait bonus to his Armor Class. This bonus lasts for 1 round, so long as you and the tar

trait.Name: Sovyrian Pantheist
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (history) checks to recognize or evaluate art, Knowledge (architecture and engineering) checks, Survival checks to hunt game, Constitution checks to run, and Spellcraft checks involving crystals or gems

trait.Name: Spirits in the Stone
trait.Benefit: Whenever you’re in ruins, you gain a +2 trait bonus on Initiative checks and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against traps and natural hazards

trait.Name: Successful Shirker
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Stealth checks and a +3 trait bonus on Bluff and Diplomacy checks to avoid punishment by lawful authority

trait.Name: Suspicious
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sense Motive checks, and Sense Motive is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Teachers Pet
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus to one Knowledge skill of your choosing and consider it a class skill.

trait.Name: Theoretical Magician
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Spellcraft checks, or a +3 bonus if you aren't a spellcaster.
trait.Description: You’ve studied more magic than what you can actually perform.

trait.Name: Tomb Raider
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Perception and Knowledge (dungeoneering) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) becomes a class skill for you
trait.Description: You’ve spent most of your life exploring the ancient tombs and catacombs of Osirion.

trait.Name: Trouper
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks using a Perform skill of your choice and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against abilities that rely upon the Perform skill to function, such as the bardic performance class ability.
trait.Description: You cling to the Varisian traveling performer traditions and can recognize the magic hidden in song and dance.

trait.Name: Under Siege
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Bluff and Sense Motive checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: In order to maintain your devotion to Sarenrae in Taldor and stay alive, you and your fellow worshipers developed a complex system of hand signs and facial gestures to identify yourselves as faithful in the Cult of the Dawnflower.

trait.Name: Unhappy Childhood (Religious)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Reflex saves.
trait.Description: Gaedren tortured you and left you for dead on a garbage heap after you made one too many errors. Your scars and memories have honed your reaction speed and make you rather jumpy.

trait.Name: Unhappy Childhood (Tortured)
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Concentration checks.
trait.Description: You found a holy symbol of the god you worship today while on a job for Gaedren and, intrigued by it, you snuck off to attend services. When Gaedren found out, he beat you to within an inch of your life and broke your holy symbol. Your faith let you block

trait.Name: Uwaga Highlander
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Stealth checks. This trait bonus increases to +2 in hilly or rocky areas.
trait.Description: You were born and raised in western Katapesh, in the rugged badlands and hills of the Uwaga Highlands. Even if you were born in a city like Solku, you often had to travel the dangerous trails with your family. Predators, gnolls, and worse haunt the Uwaga

trait.Name: Vagabond Child
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on that skill, and it is always a class skill for you

trait.Name: Venicaan Medic
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus to Heal checks to treat diseases or poisons, and Heal is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You have studied at the College of Medicaments and Chirurgery, and know by sight the signs of ailments and toxins you might encounter.

trait.Name: Warrior of Old
trait.Benefit: You gain a +2 trait bonus on Initiative checks.
trait.Description: As a child, you put in long hours in combat drills, and though time has made this training a dim memory, you still have a knack for quickly responding to trouble.

trait.Name: Watchdog
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sense Motive skill checks, and Sense Motive becomes a class skill for you.
trait.Description: As a member of the Shadow Lodge, you are trained to detect lies and doublespeak.

trait.Name: Watching Taldor
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Initiative checks, and if you are able to act during the surprise round of an encounter, you can draw a weapon (but not a potion or magic item) as a free action during that round.
trait.Description: You have spent all of your adult life with eyes turned northward, waiting for the Taldan weaklings to give you an excuse to fight, ready to act at a moment’s notice.

trait.Name: Well-Informed
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus to Diplomacy checks and Knowledge (local) checks (when attempting to gather Information). One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: You make it a point to know everyone and to be connected to everything around you. You frequent the best taverns, attend all of the right events, and graciously help anyone who needs it. Because of this, you are one of the more knowledgeable people in you

trait.Name: Westcrown Firebrand
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Initiative checks, and if you act in a surprise round, you gain a +1 trait bonus on all attack rolls.
trait.Description: There’s something very wrong with the world. Spouses were not meant to huddle at their windows hoping and fearing day after day that their loved ones returned from work safely. Parents were not meant to hush their children when questioned about what happe

trait.Name: World Traveler
trait.Benefit: Select one of the following skills: Diplomacy, Knowledge local, or Sense Motive. You gain a +1 trait bonus to that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
trait.Description: Your family has taken the love of travel to an extreme, roaming the world extensively. You’ve seen dozens of cultures and have learned to appreciate the diversity of what the world has to offer.

trait.Name: Youthful Mischief
trait.Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Reflex saves.
trait.Description: Though you gave up the life of a padfoot, scout, or minstrel decades before, you still know how to roll with the punches when things turn sour.

trait.Name: Zealot
trait.Prerequisites: You must match the alignment of your chosen deity exactly.
trait.Benefit: Religion is a class skill and gets + 1 to skill rolls
trait.Description: You aren’t just faithful to the worship of your patron deity—you are obsessively loyal to all of the faith’s tenets and guidelines. Your devotion is an anchor that keeps you from drifting away into the throes of the Bleaching, and you cling to it like the
